definition: a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)/(to agree etc) unreservedly
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
mouth full of literary phrases/to spout the classics
pinyin: man3 kou3 zhi1 hu1 zhe3 ye3

sentences.english: Wang Xueming keen on the idea, so she came to Beijing to complete the procedure.
sentences.chinese: 王学明满口答应，让她来北京办手续。

sentences.english: I readily promised, and say a person to walk not frightened.
sentences.chinese: 我满口答应了，并说一个人走不害怕。

sentences.english: Not like the foul-mouthed bunch today.
sentences.chinese: 可不像现在那些满口脏话的年轻人。

sentences.english: I was stunned by his remarks full of vile curses.
sentences.chinese: 他的满口脏话令我齿冷。

sentences.english: He became abusive when he was drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他喝醉时就满口脏话骂人了。

sentences.english: Xia Hongfang concerned about Exchange rate every day in the past, now full of pollution-free.
sentences.chinese: 夏红芳过去每天关心汇率，而今满口无公害。

sentences.english: In agreeing so readily, he had an axe to grind.
sentences.chinese: 他满口答应了这件事，是有他自己的算盘的。

sentences.english: Their vocabulary bristles fashionably with talk of federalism.
sentences.chinese: 他们开口闭口都是联邦制度，满口时髦词汇。

sentences.english: He was a philosopher, full of little sayings and homilies about the ways of the world.
sentences.chinese: 他是哲学家，满口关于处世的要言妙道。

sentences.english: I would order my cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.
sentences.chinese: 我就在他面前将我的案件陈明，满口辩白。

sentences.english: Of course even in 1884, everyone knew this was bunk.
sentences.chinese: 当然，即使在当时每个人都知道他在满口胡言。

sentences.english: Foul-mouthed children should be severely punished.
sentences.chinese: 满口脏话的孩子应该被严厉处罚。

sentences.english: I would order [my] cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.
sentences.chinese: 我就在他面前将我的案件陈明，满口辩白。

sentences.english: After eating a few mouthfuls, put downyour knife and fork and just take a break.
sentences.chinese: 当满口吃过几次食物后，记得放下刀叉休息一下。

sentences.english: Avoid platitudes, such as â Time heals all wounds.â
sentences.chinese: 避免满口的陈腔滥调，比如“时间会治愈一切的伤。”

definition: a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)
readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
mouth and teeth/enunciation/to articulate/diction/age (of cattle, horses etc)
(of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place/(of grease etc) dripping everywhere/flowing all over the place
to assail the nostrils (of fragrance and odors)
to open one's mouth (to eat, speak etc)/to gape/to start talking (esp. to make a request)
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
